item.title: Finally, a Directive safeguarding platform work - What's next?
item.description: Catherine Jacqueson, Professor of EU law and Alberto Barrio, postdoctoral researcher on the WorkWel-project, Law Faculty, University of Copenhagen Photo credit: conceptphoto.info, via FlickrÂ On April 24th, the European Parliament officially approved the directive designed to protect platform workers. Although formal endorsement from the Council is still pending, this is largely a formality. The directive’s passage, despite the challenges and last-minute negotiations, signifies a victory. Initially, the Council presented resistance, making its unexpected adoption of the compromise agreement on March 11th surprising.

item.title: Uber Malaysia users now have the option to request a driver who speaks Mandarin
item.description: Source: Uber Malaysia. Uber Malaysia is introducing UberMANDARIN, a new service in Johor Bahru, Kota Kinabalu, and Penang that connects riders with Mandarin-speaking UberX drivers. According to Warren Tseng, GM of Uber Malaysia and Singapore, the Ministry of Tourism and Culture projects a significant increase in Chinese tourists, from 3 million this year to potentially 8 million by 2020. UberMANDARIN aims to support the government’s tourism initiatives by offering Mandarin-speaking visitors a more comfortable and convenient experience, aligning with Malaysia’s renowned hospitality.

item.title: Uber for Business is growing with a new transportation solution for customers
item.description: Uber for Business is a platform designed to help companies enhance their operational efficiency through streamlined billing, reporting, and management tools. Initially focused on business travel, the platform has expanded to encompass various facets of customer transportation. This expansion is facilitated by UberCENTRAL, a solution integrated into the Uber for Business platform. UberCENTRAL enables companies to elevate the customer experience by offering on-demand, door-to-door transportation. item.title: Enter for a chance to win a trip to Barcelona with UberHOLIDAY and Qatar Airways
item.description: Source: Uber Malaysia. Qatar Airways will fly three lucky winners and their partners on a whirlwind trip to Spain. On January 12, 2017, Uber users in Malaysia have the opportunity to win an unforgettable trip to Barcelona, Spain through UberHOLIDAY. This promotion is a collaboration with the Qatar Airways Travel Festival 2017. Three winners and their partners will be chosen to receive a ride to the airport and flown to Barcelona on the same day, contingent upon having valid passports and meeting Spain’s visa requirements*.
